column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////Personal experience: The only thing I wish they would change is to have an option for gluten-free noodles. My mother unfortunately is Gluten intolerant
column2: and we tried to take her to JINYA. I was under the assumption the spinach noodles were gluten free
column3: but the waiter kindly informed us the only thing gluten free was the edamame. While I understand gluten-free people are usually gluten-free by choice
column4: and it really isn't in a restaurant's best interest to have gluten free noodles for 1% of customers ( this isn't California I guess)
column5: I would really have liked to have her try Ramen for the first time at JINYA
column6: but I guess I will be taking her to AGU ramen
